#summary BridJ comes with specialized trimmed-down packagings

= Default package =

It's very easy to add a dependency to BridJ in Maven, Gradle, Sbt, Rake or other build managers :
{{{
<dependencies>
  <dependency>
    <groupId>com.nativelibs4java</groupId>
    <artifactId>bridj</artifactId>
    <version>0.4.2</version>
    <!--
    <classifier>c-only</classifier>
    -->
  </dependency>
  ...
</dependencies>
<repositories>
  <repository>
    <id>nativelibs4java</id>
    <name>nativelibs4java Maven2 Repository</name>
    <url>http://nativelibs4java.sourceforge.net/maven</url>
  </repository>
  ...
</repositories>
}}}

= Smaller packages =

If you're worried about the size of your program and don't need support for all the platforms or languages supported by BridJ, you might want to choose a trimmed-down package by specifying a _classifier_ in the dependency definition.

Here's the list of the various classifiers available as deployed maven artifacts :

|| Classifier || C || C++ || Objective-C || COM || MFC || .NET || Windows (x86, x64) || MacOS X (universal) || iOS (arm) || Linux (x86, x64) || Solaris (x86) || Android (arm) ||
